reviews.text: Very delicious Korean noodle soups with various toppings and friendly staffs for customers.
Went there for dinner and it was pretty good. Food tasted good and the service was good too.

What a gem! Delicious Kalguksu (I opted for the spicy regular version and it was very very good) and huge servings at great prices.

The pickled ginger was good, but the kimchi is maybe the best I've had atca restaurant. I could tell that the jeons or pancakes were the thing to get, but I was solo so will have to wait for support to order that.

Service was efficient and good. I do mot think there was one table (it was pretty packed for a weekday afternoon) that wasn't filled with Koreans.

Can't wait to return to try more items.
æµ·é®®é¤…ç‰¹åˆ¥ä¸ä¸€æ¨£å¥½åƒï¼Œé‚„æœ‰ä»–å€‘çš„éºµå’ŒQå°èœæ¯ä¸€é“éƒ½æ¸…çˆ½å¥½åƒğŸ˜‹æˆ‘ä¸‹æ¬¡å»æœƒé»ä¸ä¸€æ¨£çš„è©¦çœ‹çœ‹

Donâ€™t come here if youâ€™re not Korean or donâ€™t speak Korean. My parents went to this restaurant on Saturday. They put their name down and waited patiently by the book. They waited a long time but itâ€™s to be expected on a weekend. When it was almost their turn, the hostess asked if they would like to pick their food so that they could start their order. My parents had already picked their dishes and were about to be seated when a Korean couple walked into the restaurant and after speaking Korean to the staff, were given the table that was supposed to be for my parents. My mother confronted the staff and told them that this was not right. While the staff tried to ask the Korean couple to come back they had already sat down. My parents were given the next table, a 4 top instead. While they said the food was good, this treatment by the restaurant staff was unacceptable and ruined their experience. Itâ€™s one thing if my parents had waited outside and did not see them being skipped over, but my mom was sitting right next to the book and could clearly see that they were next and the staff still chose to seat the Korean couple before my parents. This restaurant does not treat all of their customers fairly and shows blatant favoritism to Korean customers. We will never visit this restaurant again.
Tastes decent but extremely heavy on the msg

Me and my momâ€™s favorite restaurant.
Very clean and cozy mood inside
Food is really good well.
They dont let you take the kimchi, they are definitely reusing it. Make sure not to eat it. Also the noddles are bland + unremarkable. This place is not worth your money.
Delicious handmade noodle soup and Korean pancake. Be prepared to wait, but it is definitely worth it.
The seafood oko pajun was fantastic. Great service and the food came out pretty fast.

They have delicious Korean calguksoo noodles that are great for rainy/winter days. Their kimchi is fresh and very well made and their appetizers are lit. Their pancakes and the dumplings are all very well made. A regular place I go to and every time I leave satisfied.
Consistently the best kalgooksu in Flushing
Sondubu Kalguksu was sooo yummy ! A bit far from central Flushing without a car but we took the bus to get there and it was fine :)

I thought it was overhyped, but it's actually definitely very good. Best pajun I've ever had. Be sure to come with at least 1 other person though or you won't finish. The sujebi is good, too. Would definitely come back
Noodles craving?! This is the spot to go!
best seafood pancake of my life, if you donâ€™t get this youâ€™ll regret it. the hand ripped noodles are amazing too! canâ€™t wait to be back.
My seafood noodle was delicious.

This place is awesome! We get takeout here often but the food definitely tastes better here. However, the items are always well packed and always arrive impressively piping hot. It never disappoints.

Their food is delicious and the service is friendly. I love that the silverware and napkins are available table side.

They give you a generous portion of kimchi and don't skimp on the refills. Their kimchi is definitely one of my favorites. I'd also like to note that they include a good portion with your meal - even if you're ordering takeout.

I don't think you could go wrong with w any of their noodle dishes, but definitely try their seafood pancake. It's delicious!

This place is super busy on Saturdays so plan accordingly. Clean and spacious. I wish that they were open on Sundays.
I love this place so much, especially the kimchi! I bought a quart of it last time.
Amazing food and atmosphere. The staff are always so nice. Daesung has to be my favorite Korean spot in Queens.

Best Korean noodle place!
Amazing seafood pancake.

Favorite go to for healthy takeout. Noodles and Kimchi perfect
IT WAS AMAZING!! this brown hair woman gave me extra candy ğŸ¬ ê°ì‚¬í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤ :))

Worst restaurant ever!! be aware of people who have disability I got refused service by the owner and the employee because of my disability. theyre discriminating people who have disability my dog got refused as well. The owner told me disability is who donâ€™t have legs or arms not anything else. They need to get more education about this also I already report about this to the Civil Rights Division in NY theyâ€™re going to give me an update later and I will post again!!!!
soondobu jigae with rice and side of banchans. thatâ€™s like one of the best comforting food. This place didnâ€™t disappoint. very delicious bowl of soup and side dishes were awesome.
Es muy bonito el lugar y la comida estÃ¡ muy buena ğŸ‘Œ.
Amazing food (seafood pancake and noodle dishes), kind service, place was clean and spacious.
very good food.  we came there at 9 and they had food waiting even with cloaing at 9.

Bibim guksu is perfectly cooked and perfectly sweet and spicy.
Haemul pajeon is so crispy and tasty with lots of seafood.
I just loved all of their menu. The servers are kind and attentive.
This will be on my list from now. Even though I am not so crazy about kalguksu.
The waiter said we couldn't pack the kimchi to go, that was half eaten because they sell it separately. I'm confused.
The knife cut noodles is good, but the soup.  The soup base is amazing.
The noodles and soup are good! Clean atmosphere but parking is horrendous
Tasty noodles and good quantity

We stumbled upon this gem just being in the neighborhood and looking for food. I was amazed at how delicious everything was. We ordered a pancake which was probably one of the best seafood pancakes I've had. The noodles were just the right amount of chewy and the broth was flavorful. Will definitely be back.

The clam noodle soup is the best in NYC! If you like thinner sujebi you can ask for it. The soup taste does tend to fluctuate a little but its the best one!! The kimchi is also fresh and delicious.

Best Kalguksoo ever in the US. Don't need to miss Kalguksoo in South Korea. All staffs are so nice. Cleanness is exceptional. Highly Recommend. Must Go.
